intro: Ricinocarpos taxifolia, commonly known as the slender false holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rhamnaceae. It is native to regions of East Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves that are arranged alternately along the stems. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow and appear in clusters, followed by small, woody fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
